sentence.Network_en: When life gets hard and you want to give up, remember that life is full of ups and downs, and without the downs, the ups would mean nothing.
sentence.Network_cn: 当生活很艰难，你想要放弃的时候，请记住，生活充满了起起落落，如果没有低谷，那站在高处也失去了意义。

sentence.Network_en: The turning point in the process of growing up is when you discover the core of strength within you that survives all hurt.
sentence.Network_cn: 当你从内心深处找到一种可以忍受一切痛苦的坚强力量时，你的成长历程就会出现飞跃。

sentence.Network_en: He finished his conversation and stood up, looking straight at me.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说完话站起来，直视着我。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)it is the end or there is no hope for (someone or something)

phrase.cizu_name: on the up and up informal 非正式

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)something unusual or undesirable is happening or afoot
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)不寻常（或不好）的事发生了
(非正式)面对某种困难，面临某种困境

lj.lj_ly: they play better when they're up against it.
lj.lj_ls: 面对困难时，他们打得更好。

jx.jx_en_mean: no longer in bed (after sleep or an illness)
jx.jx_cn_mean: （睡眠或生病后） 起床；下床

lj.lj_ly: a normal young chap wants to be up and doing.
lj.lj_ls: 正常的年轻人总想积极向上。

lj.lj_ly: pacing up and down in front of her desk.
in clubs up and down the country.
my relationship with her was up and down.
lj.lj_ls: 我和她的关系变化不定。

jx.jx_en_mean: (especially of a computer system) in operation; functioning

lj.lj_ly: the new computer is up and running.
the new computer is up and running.

jx.jx_en_mean: appearing for a hearing in the presence of

lj.lj_ly: we'll have to come up before a magistrate.
lj.lj_ls: 我们将不得不出庭面对治安法官。

lj.lj_ly: the house next door is up for sale.
he had been up for promotion.
his contract is up for renewal in June.
lj.lj_ls: 他的合同将在六月到期续签。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)ready to take part in (a particular activity)

lj.lj_ly: Nigel was really &B{up for it}, as always.
lj.lj_ls: 像平常一样，奈吉尔真准备好参加了。

lj.lj_ly: he led me up hill and down dale till my feet were dropping off.
lj.lj_ls: 他领着我到处走，直到我的腿都快断了。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)in the brain (with reference to intelligence)

lj.lj_ly: a man with nothing much up top.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English up(p), uppe, of Germanic origin: related to Dutch op and German auf

collins.tran: 介词、副词和形容词用法

usage_note.note: Up is often used with verbs of movement such as ‘jump’ and ‘pull’, and also in phrasal verbs such as ‘give up’ and ‘wash up’.
usage_note.translation: 常与 jump, pull等表示动作的动词连用，亦用于 give up，wash up等短语动词中。

entry.def: If a person or thing goes up something such as a slope, ladder, or chimney, they move away from the ground or to a higher position.

example.ex: They were climbing up a narrow mountain road...
example.tran: 他们正沿一条狭窄的山路向上爬。

example.ex: I ran up the stairs and saw Alison lying at the top...
example.tran: 我跑上楼梯，见艾莉森躺在那里。

entry.def: If a person or thing is up something such as a ladder or a mountain, they are near the top of it.

example.ex: He was up a ladder sawing off the tops of his apple trees...
example.tran: 他正站在梯子顶上锯他那颗苹果树的树冠。

example.ex: The Newton Hotel is halfway up a steep hill.
example.tran: 丽东酒店位于陡峭的半山腰上。

entry.def: You use up to indicate that you are looking or facing in a direction that is away from the ground or towards a higher level.

example.ex: Paul answered, without looking up...
example.tran: 保罗头也没抬地答了话。

example.ex: Keep your head up, and look around you from time to time.
example.tran: 要抬起头，不时看看四周。

entry.def: If someone stands up, they move so that they are standing.

example.ex: He stood up and went to the window...
example.tran: 他起身走向窗户。

example.ex: He got up and went out into the foyer.
example.tran: 他起身出去走进了大堂。

entry.def: If you go or look up something such as a road or river, you go or look along it. If you are up a road or river, you are somewhere along it.

example.ex: A line of tanks came up the road from the city...
example.tran: 一排坦克由市里沿路开来。

example.ex: We leaned on the wooden rail of the bridge and looked up the river...
example.tran: 我们靠在桥的木栏杆上，朝河望去。

entry.tran: 向(或在)某地;(尤指)向(或在)北方，向(或在)地势更高处;
entry.def: If you are travelling to a particular place, you can say that you are going up to that place, especially if you are going towards the north or to a higher level of land. If you are already in such a place, you can say that you are up there.

example.ex: I'll be up to see you tomorrow...
example.tran: 我明天来看你。

example.ex: He was living up North...
example.tran: 他当时住在北部。

entry.def: If you go up to something or someone, you move to the place where they are and stop there.

example.ex: The girl ran the rest of the way across the street and up to the car...
example.tran: 那个女孩开始跑起来，一路跑到街对面的汽车旁边。

example.ex: On the way out a boy of about ten came up on roller skates...
example.tran: 出去时一个十来岁的男孩踩着溜冰鞋滑了过来。

entry.def: If an amount of something goes up, it increases. If an amount of something is up, it has increased and is at a higher level than it was.

example.ex: They recently put my rent up...
example.tran: 他们最近提高了我的租金。

example.ex: Tourism is up, jobs are up, individual income is up...
example.tran: 旅游火了，工作机会多了，个人收入涨了。

entry.def: If you are up, you are not in bed.

example.ex: Are you sure you should be up?...
example.tran: 你肯定你该起床了吗？

example.ex: These days all sorts of people were up at the crack of dawn...
example.tran: 这些天所有人都一大早就起来。

entry.def: If a period of time is up, it has come to an end.

example.ex: The moment the half-hour was up, Brooks rose...
example.tran: 半个小时一到，布鲁克斯便起来了。

example.ex: When the six weeks were up, everybody was sad that she had to leave.
example.tran: 6周过去了，大家都为她不得不离开而难过。

entry.def: You say that a road is up when it is being repaired and cannot be used.

example.ex: Half the road was up in Leadenhall Street, so their taxi was obliged to make a detour.
example.tran: 半条利德霍尔街都在修路，他们的出租车只好绕道走。

entry.tran: （指棒球运动员）该上场击球的
entry.def: If a baseball player is up, it is their turn to bat.
If a computer or computer system is up, it is working.
People sometimes say 'Up yours!' as an insult when you have said something to annoy them or make them angry.

example.ex: 'Up yours,' said the reporter and stormed out into the street.
example.tran: “去你的，”记者边说边怒气冲冲地冲到大街上。

entry.def: If someone who has been in bed for some time, for example because they have been ill, is up and about, they are now out of bed and living their normal life.

example.ex: How are you Lennox? Good to see you up and about.
example.tran: 你怎么样，伦诺克斯？很高兴看到你能下床走动了。

entry.def: If you say that something is up, you mean that something is wrong or that something worrying is happening.

example.ex: What is it then? Something's up, isn't it?...
example.tran: 那是怎么回事呢？出问题了，是吗？

example.ex: Mr. Gordon stopped talking, and his friends knew something was up.
example.tran: 戈登先生突然闭口不言，他的朋友们知道有哪儿不对劲了。

entry.tran: 出什么事啦？出什么问题啦？出什么毛病啦？
entry.def: If you say to someone 'What's up?' or if you tell them what's up, you are asking them or telling them what is wrong or what is worrying them.

example.ex: 'What's up?', I said to him. — 'Nothing much,' he answered...
example.tran: “出什么事啦？”我对他说。——“没什么事，”他答道。

example.ex: Let's sit down and then you can say what's up.
example.tran: 咱们先坐下来，然后你把事情告诉我。

entry.def: If you move up and down somewhere, you move there repeatedly in one direction and then in the opposite direction.

example.ex: He continued to jump up and down like a boy at a football match...
example.tran: 他不停地上蹿下跳，活像个足球赛中的男孩。

example.ex: I strolled up and down thoughtfully before calling a taxi...
example.tran: 我踱来踱去仔细思量后叫了一辆出租车。

entry.def: If you have ups and downs, you experience a mixture of good things and bad things.

example.ex: Every relationship has a lot of ups and downs...
example.tran: 每一段感情都有许多起伏。

example.ex: The organisation has had its ups and downs.
example.tran: 该机构经历过兴衰沉浮。

entry.def: If something is on the up or on the up and up, it is becoming more successful.

example.ex: They're saying that the economy is on the up...
example.tran: 他们称经济正在企稳向好。

example.ex: It was a great year for music, people had money, opportunities, hope—things were on the up and up.
example.tran: 对音乐而言，那是一个大好年头，人们有钱，有机会，有希望——一派欣欣向荣的景象。

entry.def: If someone is on the up and up, they are honest and sincere.

example.ex: I'm a pretty good judge of men. If you're honest and on the up and up, I'll be able to tell it.
example.tran: 我看人很准的。你要是诚实正派，我能看出来的。

collins.item: USED IN COMBINATION AS A PREPOSITION

entry.def: If you feel up to doing something, you are well enough to do it.

example.ex: Those patients who were up to it could move to the adjacent pool...
example.tran: 身体状况允许的病人可去隔壁的游泳池。

example.ex: He wasn't at all sure Sarah was up to that...
example.tran: 他一点都拿不准萨拉能否胜任。

entry.def: To be up to something means to be secretly doing something that you should not be doing.

example.ex: Why did you need a room unless you were up to something?...
example.tran: 除非你要搞什么小动作，不然你为什么单要一间房？

example.ex: They must have known what their father was up to...
example.tran: 他们一定已经知道了父亲要搞什么。

entry.def: If you say that it is up to someone to do something, you mean that it is their responsibility to do it.

example.ex: It was up to him to make it right, no matter how long it took...
example.tran: 由他负责把事情摆平，不管花多长时间。

example.ex: I'm sure I'd have spotted him if it had been up to me...
example.tran: 我相信要是换成我，我一定能找到他。

entry.def: Up until or up to are used to indicate the latest time at which something can happen, or the end of the period of time that you are referring to.

example.ex: Please feel free to call me any time up until half past nine at night...
example.tran: 晚上9点半之前任何时间你都可以给我打电话。

example.ex: Up to 1989, the growth of per capita income averaged 1 per cent per year.
example.tran: 一直到1989年，人均收入每年平均增长1％。

entry.def: You use up to to say how large something can be or what level it has reached.

example.ex: Up to twenty thousand students paid between five and six thousand dollars...
It could be up to two years before the process is complete.
example.tran: 这一过程可能要两年时间才能完成。

entry.def: If you say that something is not up to much, you mean that it is of poor quality.

example.ex: My own souffles aren't up to much...
example.tran: 我做的蛋奶酥拿不出手。

example.ex: This business isn't up to much.
example.tran: 这企业不怎么样。

entry.def: If someone or something is up for election, review, or discussion, they are about to be considered.

example.ex: A third of the Senate and the entire House are up for re-election.
example.tran: 参议院三分之一的席位和众议院所有席位都面临改选。

entry.def: If you are up against something, you have a very difficult situation or problem to deal with.

example.ex: The chairwoman is up against the greatest challenge to her position...
example.tran: 女主席正面临职位上的最大挑战。

example.ex: They were up against a good team but did very well.
example.tran: 他们虽然遇到劲旅，但却表现出色。

entry.def: If you up something such as the amount of money you are offering for something, you increase it.

example.ex: He upped his offer for the company...
example.tran: 他提高了给该公司的报价。

example.ex: Chemist stores upped sales by 63 percent...
example.tran: 药店销量增加了63％。

entry.def: If you up and leave a place, you go away from it, often suddenly or unexpectedly.

example.ex: A man who for months had been dropping amorous hints about a long-term relationship upped and disappeared to America...
example.tran: 几个月来不断暗示爱意、想发展长期恋爱关系的男人却突然远走美国。

example.ex: One day he just upped and left.
example.tran: 有一天他突然就离开了。

means.word_mean: 1. being or moving higher in position or greater in some value; being above a former position or level;
3. extending or moving toward a higher place;

sentences.sentence: "had to be up for the game"
"how soon will the computers be up?"

means.word_mean: 1. spatially or metaphorically from a lower to a higher position;

sentences.sentence: "he walked up and grabbed my lapels"

means.word_mean: 4. to a more central or a more northerly place;

list.explanation: 保守某事物的秘密，对某事物保密

example.en: We wanted to hush up the whole story, but there was no way to do it.
example.zh: 我们本来想对全部真情保密，似是没办法做到。

example.en: What time do you people slob up around here?
example.zh: 你们这儿什么时候开饭？

example.en: We snazzed up the room before they came.
example.zh: 在他们来以前,我们把房间装璜了一番。

list.explanation: 打，痛打，用拳头连击狠打

example.en: The thief was caught and done up.
example.zh: 那小偷被抓住了，并挨了顿痛打。

example.en: We'll do up some hash.
example.zh: 我们吸点儿大麻吧。

list.explanation: (表示反感和十分强烈反抗或拒绝的感叹语)

example.en: Up thine with turpentine, will you?
example.zh: 拿回去，好不好？

example.en: Take that token raise and up thine with turpentine.
example.zh: 这种假惺惺的加薪，你们收回去算了。

example.en: If w tried to goose it up too much, it wouldn't help anybody.
example.zh: 如果我们把它渲染得过分夸张，那对谁也没有好处。

list.explanation: 掏出、支付、交出(欠款、 赃物等)

example.en: Cough up what you owe me!
example.zh: 把你欠我的钱还给我!

example.en: We know the stolen watch is in your possession. so you may as well as cough it up.
example.zh: 我们知道那块失窃的表在你这儿，你还是把它交出来的好。

example.en: I suppose I shouldn't be coughing up these details.
example.zh: 我想我不该说出这些细节。

example.en: Ralph went out to sick.
example.zh: 拉尔夫出去呕吐了。

example.en: That stuff will make you sick up.
example.zh: 那东西会让你吃了感觉恶心。

list.explanation: 挑起事端，引起骚动，大吵大闹，大声抱怨

example.en: I don't want his lawyer to kick up a fuss about this.
example.zh: 我不想让他的律帅对此大动干戈。

example.en: I find him scrooging up his eyebrows.
example.zh: 我发现他双眉紧皱。

example.en: I poshed up my old car.
example.zh: 我把我的旧车装饰一新。

example.en: The four would not be able to hang the entire juiy up.
example.zh: 那四个人不可能难倒整个陪审团的。

example.en: He hopped himself up on heroin.
example.zh: 他吸上了海洛因。

list.explanation: (高速汽车驾驶者用语)加大汽车的功率和速度

example.en: Max hopped up his Chevrolet engine.
example.zh: 麦克斯加大了他那辆雪佛莱的马力。

example.en: The news of the victory hopped immensely up everybody at once.
example.zh: 胜利的消息立即使大家大为兴奋。

list.explanation: (尤指演员、竞技者、工人)不再干的，终止的，(失败后)完蛋的、不再有用的:"

example.en: I' m all washed-up!" said Ben Heckt.
example.zh: 本·赫克特(美围小说家、剧作家)说:"我已经洗手不干了!"

example.en: As far as he's concerned, you're a washed up nobody.
example.zh: 对他来说，你已经没有用处了。

list.explanation: (用鼻孔)吸粉末状毒品(常指吸可卡因)

example.en: One of those guys shoots it；the others smell it up.
example.zh: 那些人当中有一个人注射毒品，另外一些人则嗅吸毒品。

example.en: You must be smelling the stuff.
example.zh: 你准是在吸那东西(指毒品)。

list.explanation: 将某物装饰打扮得更漂亮

example.en: We zazzed up the room before they came.
example.zh: 在他们来之前，我们把房间好好收拾了一下。

list.explanation: 注射毒品，打一针麻醉剂

example.en: She slipped into the back room to dope up.
example.zh: 她悄悄地溜到后面的房间里去注射毒品了。

example.en: I'm hurting，man，I gotta dope up，now.
example.zh: 老兄，我现在很痛苦，我得马上打一针。

example.en: Where's my old friend Max? I gotta dope up.
example.zh: 我的老朋友马克斯在哪儿？我得买一份麻醉药。

list.explanation: (黑社会用语)带上手枪，武装起来

example.en: They do not rod up, or arm themselves.
example.zh: 他们身上不带枪，或者说没配备武器。

example.en: The project is coming up to the wire and we're a bit nervous.
example.zh: 这项工程现在正接近尾声，所以我们有点儿紧张。

example.en: Let's get guing,chum.Giddy up!
example.zh: 老兄,咱们开始吧。快点!

list.explanation: (黑社会用语)(聚会)瓜分掠夺物、分赃

example.en: All the gangsters will gather at their lair for cutting up the touches today.
example.zh: 今天所有匪徒都将在匪巢集合分赃。

example.en: The widow cuts up the pipes about her dead husband.
example.zh: 那寡妇在怀念她死去的丈夫。

example.en: I don't intend to cut up the jackpots.
example.zh: 我并不想无所事事地闲聊。

list.explanation: n. 及形容词的意思:西部武打片(的)

example.en: Most films are more sophisticated nowadays than the old shoot'em ups.
example.zh: 如今大部分影片都比那些老的西部武打片精致高明得多了。

example.en: I like the good old shoot'em up movies.
example.zh: 我喜欢看那些拍得好的老的西部武打电影。

list.explanation: 敢于说话的，坦率正直的，信得过的

example.en: And he's very, very stand-up.
example.zh: 他非常非常靠得住。

example.en: Pick'em up and lay'em down for the doctor.
example.zh: 赶快去请医生

example.en: He picked'em up and laid'em down his feel tired.
example.zh: 他跳舞跳得腿都酸了。

list.explanation: 发火，激怒，激发，引起欲念

example.en: She fires up at least thing.
example.zh: 她常为一点小事而发火。

example.en: In one word, you shouldn't fire up your opponent.
example.zh: 总之一句话, 你不应当激怒你的对手。

example.en: fire up the imagination
example.zh: 激发想像力

example.en: Fire up and split,dudes!
example.zh: 踩足油门，开路吧，哥儿们!

list.explanation: (军队用语)向某人作简要介绍，通知某人

example.en: Poop me up so I know what's up here.
example.zh: 向我简单介绍一下，以便我弄清楚这里的情况。

example.en: h is better to push up the daisies than to suffer.
example.zh: 与其受苦毋宁死。

example.en: He pushed up daisies about a year ago.
example.zh: 他大约在一年前撒手人寰了。

example.en: She was fed up at his light-hearted attitude.
example.zh: 她很厌恶他那种若无其事的态度。

example.en: We are fed up with listening to his story.
example.zh: 他的故事我们已经听腻了。

list.explanation: 为…辩护，支持、维护(某人或某事)

example.en: If his own family won't,who will stick up for him?
example.zh: 要是他自己家里的人都不管,那么谁会愿意站出来为他说话？

example.en: Stick up for your rights!
example.zh: 站起来维护你自己的权利!

example.en: He got up after his sentence was reduced.
example.zh: 他被减刑后服刑期就满了

list.explanation: [流氓团伙用语]独特的签名法(指把自己的名字涂写在公共场所的墙上)。

example.en: I always wash get-ups on Mondays.
example.zh: 我总是在星期一洗一周换下来的衣服。

example.en: Why the fancy get-up today?
example.zh: 今天打扮得花花哨哨的干嘛呀？

list.explanation: 够水平的，满意的，合格，处于良好状态的

example.en: I'm afraid this story isn't quite up to scratch.
example.zh: 我看这篇报道恐怕未必合用。

example.en: Our plans got all screwed up.
example.zh: 我们的计划全给打乱了。

list.explanation: 神经紧张的，受剌激的，神经质的

example.en: Hamlet was a sad,screwed up type guy.
example.zh: 哈姆雷特是个郁郁寡欢，精神受到刺激的典型人物。

list.explanation: a.情况良好的，达到水准的

example.en: He didn't feel up to the knocker.
example.zh: 他感到身体不大舒服。

example.en: He was prepared up to the knocker.
example.zh: 他作了最充分的准备。

list.explanation: 未解决的，未决定的，不肯定的，迟疑不决的

example.en: The question of who will attend is still up in the air.
example.zh: 关于谁出席的问题还悬而未决。

list.explanation: 十分恼火的，非常激动的

example.en: My father went straight up in the air when he heard I damaged the car.
example.zh: 父亲一听说我把车弄坏了，立即火冒三丈。

list.explanation: 认真听，十分注意(常指聆听命令)

example.en: Now, listen up!This is important.
example.zh: 好，注意听着!这很重要。

example.en: He can make you listen up with that violin of his.
example.zh: 他能叫你用心倾听他的小提琴曲。

example.en: The rent ate up half my pay.
example.zh: 房租花掉了我一半工资。

example.en: Extravagant spending ate up his saving.
example.zh: 他挥霍无度把积蓄都用完了。

list.explanation: 赞赏，倾心喜欢，极感兴趣

example.en: He really ate that show up.
example.zh: 他特别欣赏那出戏。

example.en: London society simply ate him up.
example.zh: 伦敦上流社会对他极其赞赏。

list.explanation: 感到紧张、害怕、激动、高兴或悲伤等(从而影响到做不好某事或说不出话)

example.en: He choked up, lost his concentration, and got clob-bered in the third.
example.zh: 他感到很紧张，注意力集中不起来，第三轮就被刷下来了。

example.en: She choked up and couldn't finish her speech.
example.zh: 她因过分激动而说不出话来，没能完成她的演说。

example.en: Your new book doesn't exactly choke me up.
example.zh: 你的新作可没能把我给震撼起来。

example.en: The boy was terribly choked up over the loss of his dog.
example.zh: 那孩子因为丢了他的狗而感到悲伤得不得了。

list.explanation: [军队用语]不假思索、立待完成的任务

example.en: The whole jump-up must be done in 90 minutes with little time to think and prepare.
example.zh: 这整个突击任务必须在90分钟之内完成，几乎没有时问思考和准备。

list.explanation: [戏剧用语]临时舞台，便携式舞台装置，携带活动舞台装置的巡回旅行剧团

example.en: There are some 40 off-Broadway houses. You might add another 40 off-off-Broad way clubs and fit-ups.
example.zh: 大约有40家外百老汇式的中小剧场。 你也许可以再增加40个比这更具外百老汇性的俱乐部和携带活动舞台装置的旅行剧团。

example.en: We were fitted, you ratbag!Nothing but a lousy fit-up.
example.zh: 我们是被诬陷的，你这下流坯!纯粹是无中生有、卑鄙无耻的捏造罪名。

example.en: At least,I don't know anybody who is up the wall about it.
example.zh: 至少我就不知道有谁在为此发疯。

list.explanation: 忧虑的，发愁的，心绪不好的

example.en: He' s really up the wall about Mary's illness.
example.zh: 他的确很为玛丽的病担忧。

example.en: These things are my ideas, and they've all got the same goof-ups.
example.zh: 这些是我出的主意，他们都犯了同样的大错。

list.explanation: 经常把事情搞糟的人，笨蛋

example.en: The sergeant was a confirmed goof-up.
example.zh: 那中士是人们所公认的笨蛋。

list.explanation: 诚实的，可靠的，光明磊落的

example.en: It' s an up-and-up place.
example.zh: 这是一个很循规蹈矩的地方。

example.en: Everything I do is on the up-and-up. I am totally honest.
example.zh: 我所做的一切都是光明磊落的。我是绝对诚实的。

example.en: Why should you be shook up for such trifles?
example.zh: 你何必为这蝇头小事烦恼不安？

example.en: So Woody kept his voice down, but he was all shook up.
example.zh: 于是，伍迪压低了嗓门, 但他心里却确是高兴得很。

example.en: He bollixed up the whole thing.
example.zh: 他把事情全搞糟了。

list.explanation: 激励，鼓舞，活跃起来，高兴起来

example.en: Colla perk up this class.
example.zh: 这个班级得鼓励一下才行。

example.en: He perked up at once when I promised to help him.
example.zh: 我答应帮助他时，他马上就高兴了起来。

example.en: Perk up! We're almost done.
example.zh: 加油!我们快完成了。

example.en: He's perking up after a two-week illness.
example.zh: 他病了两个星期,现在正在康复起来。

example.en: Somebody perked up here!
example.zh: 有人在这里吐了!

example.en: If it's not the real wake-up pill, I don't want it.
example.zh: 假如这不是真的兴奋丸，我可不要。

example.en: Can you pack him up?
example.zh: 你叫他别说了，行吗？

example.en: His job wasn't much, but he pumped it up into a key assignment.
example.zh: 他的工作原本并不重要，可是他却夸大其词说是关键任务。

example.en: Experts like Dr Edward Teller steadily pumped up Reagan about the potential of such defensive-weapons systems.
example.zh: 爱德华·特勒之流的专家不停地鼓动里根相信这种防御武器系统的潜在力量。

auth_sentence.content: The Re-Up also seems to have an ulterior motive.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Re-Up also seems to have an ulterior motive.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Re-Up also seems to have an ulterior motive.

auth_sentence.content: Repeat the process until the batter is used up.
auth_sentence.res_content: Repeat the process until the batter is used up.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Repeat the process until the batter is used up.

auth_sentence.content: It's like old-school soul only with up-to-date instruments.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's like old-school soul only with up-to-date instruments.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's like old-school soul only with up-to-date instruments.

abbreviation.mean_cn: 酒精含量在标准浓度下的，不合格的

Sentence.sentence: This week's program Up Your Street takes you to Harrogate, a small town in Yorkshire.

sentences.en: They stood up when he came in.
sentences.cn: 当他进来时, 他们都站起来。

means.word_mean: 趋于较高处；向（或在）较高位置；向上；在上面

sentences.cn: 我们完成了所有的工作。

means.word_mean: 向上的, 上行的，往上移动的
站起身, 提高(价格等)

sentences.en: There was a workman up the ladder.
sentences.cn: 有一个工人在梯子上工作。

sentences.en: The ship is sailing up the Nile.
sentences.cn: 这艘船顺尼罗河向上游航行。

jushi.english: They stood up when he came in.
jushi.chinese: 当他进来时,他们都站起来。
